intro: Rytigynia longipedicellata, commonly known as the long pedicellate rytigynia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and opposite, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
